Syllable Position: followed by 2 or more unstressed syllables
before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)
before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)

Examples: want, watch, quality, squash, swamp, wapiti, swastika, wallet

Syllable Position: after /w/ before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)
Examples: war, award, dwarf, warning, quarter, warring
about, an, salary, woman, blancmange, opera, via

Syllable Position: before final r or r + other cons.(and in derived terms)
before final r or r + other cons.(and in derived terms)
before final r or r + vowel(and in derived terms)

Examples: deuce, feudal, queue, dew, ewe, view
cited, dive, mica, rise, polite, shine
kiss, sic, bit, inflict, hint, plinth

Syllable Position: before r + vowel (except bef. 2+ unstressed syllables)
before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)
before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)
before final r or r + cons.(and in derived terms)
after j, r, or cons. + l

Examples: conduit, cuing, genuine, Buick, circuitous, Jesuit
